title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 3.

questions.question: What was Ezekiel commanded to eat in Ezekiel 3:1?
questions.correctAnswer: A roll
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:1 states that he was told to eat a roll.

questions.question: How did Ezekiel describe the taste of the roll he ate in Ezekiel 3:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Sweet as honey
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:3 says the roll was in his mouth as honey for sweetness.

questions.question: To whom was Ezekiel sent to speak in Ezekiel 3:4?
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:4 commands him to go to the house of Israel and speak God's words.

questions.question: What kind of people was Ezekiel NOT sent to, according to Ezekiel 3:5?
questions.correctAnswer: People of a strange speech
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:5 clarifies he was not sent to people of a strange speech and hard language.

questions.question: What did God say about the house of Israel's response to Ezekiel in Ezekiel 3:7?
questions.correctAnswer: They will not hearken
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:7 states the house of Israel will not hearken to Ezekiel or to God.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 3:8, what has God made Ezekiel's face like?
questions.correctAnswer: Strong against their faces
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:8 says God made Ezekiel's face strong against the faces of the Israelites.

questions.question: What is Ezekiel's forehead compared to in Ezekiel 3:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Adamant harder than flint
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:9 compares Ezekiel's forehead to adamant harder than flint.

questions.question: Where did Ezekiel go to speak to the captivity according to Ezekiel 3:11?
options: To the children of his people
questions.correctAnswer: To the children of his people
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:11 commands Ezekiel to speak to the children of his people who were in captivity.

questions.question: What did Ezekiel hear behind him with a great rushing sound in Ezekiel 3:12?
options: Blessed be the glory of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed be the glory of the LORD
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:12 describes hearing a voice behind him saying, Blessed be the glory of the LORD.

questions.question: How long did Ezekiel sit astonished among the captives at Telabib according to Ezekiel 3:15?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:15 says he sat among them astonished for seven days.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was made a watchman unto the house of Israel as stated in Ezekiel 3:17.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:17 explicitly states that he was made a watchman unto the house of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was told in Ezekiel 3:18 that if he does not warn the wicked, their blood will be required at his hand.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:18 explains the responsibility Ezekiel bears if he fails to warn the wicked.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was instructed to go into the plain where the glory of the LORD stood, as per Ezekiel 3:22-23.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:22-23 describes the LORD's hand upon Ezekiel and his going into the plain where the glory stood.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ezekiel 3:24: 'Go, shut thyself within ________.'
questions.correctAnswer: thine house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:24 instructs Ezekiel to shut himself within his house.

questions.question: What did God say would happen to Ezekiel's tongue in Ezekiel 3:26?
options: It shall cleave to the roof of his mouth
questions.correctAnswer: It shall cleave to the roof of his mouth
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:26 states that Ezekiel's tongue would cleave to the roof of his mouth so he would be dumb among the rebellious house.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with obedience to God's calling despite opposition. Based on Ezekiel 3, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance?
options: God strengthens us to be firm and fearless in our mission
We should avoid difficult tasks to maintain peace
Opposition means we should stop speaking God's word
We should only speak when others agree with us
questions.correctAnswer: God strengthens us to be firm and fearless in our mission
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:8-9 teaches that God made Ezekiel's face strong against the rebellious house of Israel, so he should not fear or be dismayed by their looks. This encourages believers to persevere boldly in obedience to God's calling despite opposition.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 3 instruct us about the responsibility of warning others who live in sin?
options: We must warn the wicked to save their lives
We should ignore sinners and focus on ourselves
Only priests have the duty to warn sinners
Warning is optional based on personal preference
questions.correctAnswer: We must warn the wicked to save their lives
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:17-19 emphasizes that the prophet is appointed as a watchman to warn the wicked. If he fails to warn them, their blood is required at his hand, but if he warns and they do not turn, he saves his own soul.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged because people do not listen to their testimony. According to Ezekiel 3, what should they remember about their role?
options: Their duty is to speak God's words regardless of response
They should only speak to those who agree with them
They should stop sharing if people reject them
Their role is to seek popularity in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Their duty is to speak God's words regardless of response
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:11 instructs Ezekiel to speak to the captives whether they hear or forbear, showing that obedience to God's command is paramount even if people reject the message.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 3 illustrate the importance of receiving God's word personally before ministering to others?
options: One must internalize and delight in God's word as Ezekiel did
It is enough to only read the Bible publicly without personal devotion
Ministers should focus on human wisdom rather than God's word
Preaching should be done without preparation
questions.correctAnswer: One must internalize and delight in God's word as Ezekiel did
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:1-3 describes how Ezekiel eats the scroll and finds it as sweet as honey, symbolizing the need to receive God's word fully and joyfully before speaking it to others.

questions.question: In what way does Ezekiel 3 teach us about humility and accepting God’s discipline during trials?
options: Ezekiel accepted being bound and silenced as God’s discipline
We should reject trials as signs of God's anger
Trials mean we are abandoned by God
We can ignore God’s instructions during hardship
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel accepted being bound and silenced as God’s discipline
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:24-26 shows that Ezekiel was told to shut himself in and be bound, with his tongue silenced, demonstrating humble submission to God’s plan even in difficult circumstances.

questions.question: How can Ezekiel 3 guide a believer’s approach to evangelism when facing rejection?
options: Speak God's message faithfully, regardless of acceptance
Stop evangelizing when people reject the message
Only share the gospel with friends and family
Change the message to please listeners
questions.correctAnswer: Speak God's message faithfully, regardless of acceptance
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:7 and 3:27 show that Israel was rebellious and often would not listen, yet Ezekiel was commanded to speak the Lord's words faithfully, letting those who hear, hear, and those who refuse, refuse.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to maintain integrity in their work. How does the example of Ezekiel’s obedience in chapter 3 encourage integrity?
options: Obey God's instructions fully, even when difficult
Compromise if it benefits your career
Follow popular opinion over God’s word
questions.correctAnswer: Obey God's instructions fully, even when difficult
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:10-11 encourages receiving all God’s words in the heart and obeying by delivering His warnings fully, indicating integrity in faithfully fulfilling God’s calling regardless of difficulty.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was sent to people with a strange language and hard speech whom he could not understand.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:5-6 clearly states Ezekiel was sent to the house of Israel, not to many people with strange speech or hard language, emphasizing the clarity of the mission.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel was told his responsibility was to only warn righteous people and not the wicked.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:17-21 explains that Ezekiel must warn both the wicked and the righteous. Failure to warn either results in consequences, but warning delivers the soul.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ezekiel was told to eat the scroll which was ______ in his mouth as honey for sweetness.
questions.correctAnswer: like honey
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:3 describes how the scroll was in Ezekiel’s mouth as honey for sweetness, symbolizing delight and acceptance of God’s word.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 3 guide us in dealing with discouragement in ministry when people are rebellious?
options: Trust God to strengthen you and speak faithfully despite rejection
Stop ministering when people reject you
Ministry should only be to those who agree
Avoid difficult conversations to keep peace
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God to strengthen you and speak faithfully despite rejection
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:7-9 shows that though Israel was hardhearted and rebellious, God made Ezekiel’s forehead as adamant so he would not fear or be dismayed, teaching reliance on God’s strength.

questions.question: What practical lesson about spiritual discipline can a believer learn from Ezekiel’s seven days of astonishment among the captives?
options: Taking time to meditate and reflect is important
Immediate action without reflection is best
questions.correctAnswer: Taking time to meditate and reflect is important
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:15 describes Ezekiel sitting astonished among the captives for seven days, indicating a period of reflection and spiritual preparation before active ministry.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 3 demonstrate the importance of humility in accepting God's instructions even when they limit our freedom?
options: Ezekiel obeyed God’s command to shut himself and be bound
Ezekiel ignored God’s commands when inconvenient
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel obeyed God’s command to shut himself and be bound
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:24-26 shows Ezekiel was told to stay inside and be bound, and he obeyed, illustrating humility and submission to God's sovereign plans.

questions.question: A believer faces the temptation to stay silent about sin in their community. Based on Ezekiel 3, what biblical principle should guide their decision?
options: They must speak warning to save others and themselves
Silence is preferable to avoid conflict
Ignoring sin is a form of love
questions.correctAnswer: They must speak warning to save others and themselves
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:18-21 explains that failing to warn the wicked or the righteous results in death and accountability, but warning delivers the soul, emphasizing the duty to confront sin lovingly.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 3 encourage believers to trust God's timing and presence in their ministries?
options: God’s hand was strong upon Ezekiel during his mission
We should rely only on our own strength
God is silent during difficult times
questions.correctAnswer: God’s hand was strong upon Ezekiel during his mission
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:14 and 3:22 mention the strong hand of the Lord upon Ezekiel, encouraging believers to trust God’s presence and power in ministry.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 3.

questions.question: What symbolic act does God command Ezekiel to perform at the beginning of chapter 3?
options: Eat a scroll given to him
Wash his hands in the river
questions.correctAnswer: Eat a scroll given to him
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 3:1-3, God commands Ezekiel to eat the scroll, symbolizing internalizing God's word, which is described as sweet as honey in his mouth.

questions.question: Ezekiel is told he is not sent to which group of people?
options: People of a strange speech and hard language
The captives by the river Chebar
questions.correctAnswer: People of a strange speech and hard language
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:5 clarifies that he is sent specifically to the house of Israel, not to people with a strange speech or hard language.

questions.question: What is the nature of the house of Israel as described by God in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Impudent and hardhearted
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:7 describes the house of Israel as impudent and hardhearted, indicating their unwillingness to listen to God's word.

questions.question: What metaphor is used in Ezekiel 3 to describe the strength given to Ezekiel's face against the rebellious house?
questions.correctAnswer: An adamant harder than flint
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:8-9 uses the metaphor of 'adamant harder than flint' to describe the strength given to Ezekiel's forehead to confront the rebellious people.

questions.question: What role is Ezekiel appointed to in Ezekiel 3:17?
options: Watchman unto the house of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Watchman unto the house of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:17 explicitly states that God has made Ezekiel a watchman to warn the house of Israel of impending danger.

questions.question: What consequence is described if Ezekiel fails to warn the wicked of their ways?
options: The wicked man will die in his iniquity and his blood will be required at Ezekiel's hand
Ezekiel will be punished by God
The wicked will be forgiven regardless
Ezekiel will lose his prophetic gift
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked man will die in his iniquity and his blood will be required at Ezekiel's hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:18 explains that if Ezekiel does not warn the wicked, the wicked will die in their sin and God will hold Ezekiel accountable for their blood.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 3, what happens if Ezekiel warns the wicked but they do not turn from their ways?
options: The wicked will still die in their iniquity, but Ezekiel will have delivered his soul
The wicked will be saved despite their refusal
Ezekiel must warn them again until they repent
God will take Ezekiel away from the people
questions.correctAnswer: The wicked will still die in their iniquity, but Ezekiel will have delivered his soul
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:19 clarifies that even if the wicked do not repent after warning, Ezekiel is not held responsible and has saved himself by giving the warning.

questions.question: What instruction does God give Ezekiel regarding the righteous who turn away from righteousness?
options: Ezekiel must warn them or their blood will be required at his hand
Ezekiel should ignore them since they were once righteous
They will be saved regardless of Ezekiel's warning
Ezekiel should pray for them silently
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel must warn them or their blood will be required at his hand
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:20 states that if the righteous man turns to sin and Ezekiel does not warn him, the man will die and God will hold Ezekiel accountable.

questions.question: What is the significance of Ezekiel sitting among the captives for seven days as described in Ezekiel 3:15?
options: It symbolizes his mourning and astonishment at the people's condition
It was a traditional teaching period
It meant he was waiting for a vision
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes his mourning and astonishment at the people's condition
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:15 indicates that Ezekiel sat among the captives in astonishment for seven days, reflecting his deep emotional response to their plight.

questions.question: The phrase 'the spirit took me up' in Ezekiel 3:12 and 3:14 is an example of which literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Prophetic transportation or visionary rapture
questions.explanation: The phrase describes Ezekiel being supernaturally moved by the Spirit to receive visions, a common prophetic experience recorded in the Hebrew Bible (Ezekiel 3:12, 3:14).

questions.question: What does God say will happen to Ezekiel's tongue in Ezekiel 3:26?
options: It will cleave to the roof of his mouth, making him dumb
It will speak with double the usual power
It will be healed and made pure
It will be like a sharp sword
questions.correctAnswer: It will cleave to the roof of his mouth, making him dumb
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:26 reveals that God will make Ezekiel's tongue stick to the roof of his mouth so he cannot speak, symbolizing enforced silence among a rebellious people.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel respond when he sees the glory of the LORD by the river of Chebar in Ezekiel 3:23?
questions.correctAnswer: He falls on his face
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:23 describes that upon seeing the glory of the LORD, Ezekiel falls on his face, a sign of reverence and awe in ancient Near Eastern culture.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 3, who are the 'children of thy people' mentioned in the context of captivity?
questions.correctAnswer: The Israelites exiled in Babylon
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:11 refers to the children of his people in captivity as the Israelites who were exiled, historically the Babylonian captivity near the river Chebar.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'Thus saith the Lord GOD' signify in Ezekiel 3:27?
options: It introduces a divine message of authority
It indicates a question from God
It signals the end of a prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: It introduces a divine message of authority
questions.explanation: The phrase is a prophetic formula that introduces God's authoritative words to be delivered by Ezekiel, emphasizing the seriousness of the message (Ezekiel 3:27).

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel is instructed that whether the people hear or forbear, he must still deliver God's message.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:11 states that Ezekiel must speak to the captives 'whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear,' meaning he must deliver the message regardless.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What symbolic action does God command Ezekiel to perform to prepare him for his prophetic mission?
options: Eat the scroll given to him
questions.correctAnswer: Eat the scroll given to him
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:1-3 describes God instructing Ezekiel to eat the scroll, which symbolizes internalizing God's words before speaking them to Israel. This act reflects the importance of receiving God's message fully, similar to Jeremiah 15:16 and Revelation 10:9-10 where eating a scroll signifies internalizing God's word.

questions.question: To whom is Ezekiel specifically sent to prophesy according to Ezekiel 3?
questions.correctAnswer: The house of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:4-5 clearly states that Ezekiel is sent to the house of Israel, emphasizing God's focus on His covenant people. This is consistent with God's dealings with Israel throughout Scripture as in Isaiah 6:8 and Jeremiah 1:5 where prophets are called specifically to Israel.

questions.question: What reason does God give for Ezekiel not being sent to a people of strange speech and hard language?
options: They would have hearkened unto him
They did not need a prophet
questions.correctAnswer: They would have hearkened unto him
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:6 explains that if Ezekiel were sent to foreign peoples with strange language, they would have listened to him, contrasting with Israel's rebelliousness. This highlights Israel's unique responsibility and spiritual obstinacy, paralleling Deuteronomy 7:6 and Jeremiah 7:27.

questions.question: What characteristic does God ascribe to the house of Israel that affects their response to Ezekiel's message?
questions.correctAnswer: Impudent and hardhearted
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:7 describes Israel as impudent and hardhearted, explaining their rejection of God's message. This theme of hardness is seen elsewhere, such as in Exodus 7:3, Isaiah 6:9-10, and Romans 11:7-8, indicating persistent rebellion despite God's patience.

questions.question: What metaphor does God use to describe the strength He gives Ezekiel to confront Israel's rebellion?
questions.correctAnswer: An adamant harder than flint
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:8-9 depicts God's strengthening of Ezekiel's forehead like adamant harder than flint, symbolizing divine empowerment to withstand opposition. This metaphor relates to scriptures like Isaiah 50:7 and 1 Corinthians 16:13 where God's strength sustains His servants.

questions.question: What role does God assign to Ezekiel in Ezekiel 3:17?
options: A watchman unto the house of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: A watchman unto the house of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:17 explicitly calls Ezekiel a watchman, charged with warning Israel of impending judgment. This role aligns with prophetic watchmen in Isaiah 21:6-9 and the responsibility to warn sinners seen in Acts 20:26-27.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 3, what consequence does Ezekiel face if he fails to warn the wicked of their ways?
options: He will be held responsible for their blood
He will be punished by exile
He will lose his prophetic gift
He will be struck by illness
questions.correctAnswer: He will be held responsible for their blood
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:18 states that if Ezekiel does not warn the wicked, their blood will be required at his hand, emphasizing prophetic accountability. This principle echoes in James 3:1 and Hebrews 13:17 where leaders bear responsibility for their charges.

questions.question: What is the spiritual condition of those whom Ezekiel must warn, as described in this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Rebellious house
questions.explanation: Repeatedly, including Ezekiel 3:9 and 3:27, Israel is described as a rebellious house, underscoring their resistance to God's word. This persistent rebellion mirrors Israel’s historical disobedience found in Numbers 14:24 and Jeremiah 5:23.

questions.question: What experience does Ezekiel have immediately after receiving God's words to warn Israel?
options: The spirit took him up and he heard a great rushing voice
He was struck dumb and silent
He saw a vision of the Messiah
questions.correctAnswer: The spirit took him up and he heard a great rushing voice
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:12-13 recounts the spirit lifting Ezekiel and his hearing a great rushing voice and noises, signifying divine presence and empowerment. This experience reflects prophetic encounters like Isaiah 6:4 and Revelation 4:1-2.

questions.question: How long did Ezekiel remain with the captivity at Telabib before receiving further instructions?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:15 states Ezekiel sat astonished among the captives for seven days, indicating a period of reflection and preparation. The number seven often signifies completeness as in Genesis 2:2 and Joshua 6:15.

questions.question: What does God declare regarding the fate of a righteous man who turns to sin and is not warned?
options: He shall die in his sin and his righteousness will not be remembered
He will be forgiven without consequence
He will be exalted for his past righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: He shall die in his sin and his righteousness will not be remembered
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:20 teaches that a righteous person who sins and is not warned will die in his sin, and his past righteousness will be forgotten. This underscores God's justice and responsibility, consistent with Ezekiel 18:24 and Hebrews 10:26-27.

questions.question: What instruction does God give Ezekiel regarding his speech when he is bound and unable to speak freely?
options: He will open Ezekiel’s mouth when He speaks to him
Ezekiel must speak only in dreams
questions.correctAnswer: He will open Ezekiel’s mouth when He speaks to him
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:26-27 reveals that although Ezekiel will be bound and unable to speak, God will open his mouth when He commands, showing divine control over prophetic speech. This is similar to Exodus 4:12 and Acts 4:31 where God empowers His servants to speak.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel do when he sees the glory of the LORD standing in the plain?
questions.correctAnswer: He falls on his face
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:23 records that Ezekiel falls on his face upon seeing the glory of the LORD, a common posture of reverence and submission as seen in Exodus 34:8 and Revelation 1:17.

questions.question: What does God command Ezekiel to do after the spirit sets him on his feet in the plain?
options: Go, shut thyself within thine house
Begin to preach immediately in the city
questions.correctAnswer: Go, shut thyself within thine house
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:24 directs Ezekiel to shut himself in his house, indicating a period of isolation or preparation. This instruction reflects God's sovereign timing in revelation, analogous to Daniel 10:12-13 and John 20:19 where seclusion precedes ministry.

questions.question: What is the ultimate response God says should be given to those who hear Ezekiel’s prophetic words?
options: He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear
They should write down the words
questions.correctAnswer: He that heareth, let him hear; and he that forbeareth, let him forbear
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 3:27 concludes with this declaration, emphasizing human responsibility to respond to God's message, a theme echoed in Luke 14:35 and Hebrews 2:1.
